Description: One large and two small fragments of woollen, weft-faced compound plain weave fabric; Small repeating zig-zag and diamond pattern in yellow on a red ground; Repeats vertically c.3.4cm and widthways c.2cm; Warp: S spun, c.7 tpc; Weft: paired threads; Edges: one selvedgew with three cordlines, others ragged
Curator's comments: Identifiable as a cushion or mattress cover depends on comparison with other wool textiles in the weave; Previous location Cupboard 64, brown box; Information from Hero Granger-Taylor (20/9/1989)
Condition: Fair to poor; Unknown date stuck to sticky net
